title: SQL deletes all rows and creates new rows for each change to the data
author: Loizzus
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
When using the SQL database I have found that everytime any data is updated and saved the program deletes all existing rows from dbo.tblCons and creates a full set of new rows. 

## Problem Description
This causes the database to grow to a tremendous size very quickly when working with a small team even though the total number of rows is small. For example in 4 months my database of 40 rows is sitting at ID number 6619 as th...

comments.snippet: I fix the issue in branch [sql_update#1589](https://github.com/Filippo125/mRemoteNG/tree/sql_update%231589). It has already been tested with mysql. As soon as i can i'll test with mssql.
